page.title: 12New Wood Farm, Stourton
page.content: In my village most houses are less than 40 years old, but mine is 270 years old. It is called New Wood Farm but before it was known as the Â£Old Nail House' because the front door is studded with large black nails. We bought it in 1982. It was practically derelict having been empty for two years. It was left furnished, there were newspapers dating back to 1960, tins of food in the cupboard and false teeth in a glass! It took a year to get it into decent shape. The pigstys and outbuildings except the cow shed had to be demolished. The house is of red brick, honey- suckle climbs round the windows and we have a menagerie of birds and batsin the attic. There is no feeling of eeri- ness; it is a friendly place and when the rain thrashes the window and the log fire crackles, the best place.
